name: ESSAI 2026
venue: Vienna, Austria
description: The 2026 European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria from 6 to 10 July. It offers a week‑long intensive program of introductory and advanced AI courses, tutorials, and social activities aimed at PhD students and young researchers. With over 30 lecturers and multiple parallel tracks, participants can explore a broad range of AI sub‑disciplines and network with international experts.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
venue: Skeikampen Conference Hotel, near Oslo, Norway
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory and held at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It aims to bring together European NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries, to share expertise on large‑scale multilingual language models, open‑science practices, and high‑performance e‑infrastructures. The program features technical talks, hands‑on sessions, and a walk‑through of EuroHPC experience reports, with subsidized participation and organized bus transfers from Oslo Airport.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: The ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI School taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment covering state‑of‑the‑art machine learning and artificial intelligence topics for enthusiasts, students, academics and industry professionals. The school is co‑organized with the Artificial Intelligence Association of Lithuania (AIAL) and offers participants the chance to engage with leading experts in probabilistic AI.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
venue: Durham University, Durham, England, United Kingdom
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a broad spectrum of computer‑vision topics, presented by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme features daily oral talks and hands‑on activities aimed at graduate students and early‑career researchers seeking to deepen their expertise.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
venue: University of Oxford, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: OxML Summer 2026 is a machine‑learning school organized by Oxford ML School, offering both in‑person sessions in Oxford and online participation. The programme features three specialised tracks covering the latest AI theory and applications, taught by world‑renowned experts from leading academic and industry labs. It provides a customisable learning experience where participants can combine tracks to match their goals, and applications will open soon.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026, organized by the Department for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden, targets doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It covers a broad spectrum of topics in robotics, perception and learning, including machine learning, computer vision, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making, and combines keynote talks, industry panels and brainstorming sessions. The six‑day event, held at the Happy Tammsvik resort, provides fully funded accommodation, meals and activities to foster new collaborations among participants.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
venue: Università di Genova, Genova, Italy
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts and algorithms of Machine Learning. It is aimed at undergraduate and graduate students, as well as professionals, and combines theoretical lectures with hands‑on lab sessions conducted in person at the MaLGa Center in Genoa. Participants receive university credit and must complete a final test consisting of notebook exercises and a report.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh, United Kingdom. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials and industry talks covering bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI, validation of AI methods and real‑world applications. The school targets master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, providing hands‑on experience with state‑of‑the‑art robotic technology and networking opportunities.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
venue: Hotel Dei Pini, Alghero, Italy
description: The 2026 Biometrics International Summer School takes place at Hotel Dei Pini in Porto Conte near Alghero, Sardinia, Italy. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human‑recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis, neuroscience, robotics, forensic and digital forensics. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers, forensic examiners and professionals, offering intensive lectures by 18 experts, hands‑on sessions, and optional videoconference participation with scholarships available.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
venue: Porto, Portugal
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School on the Cognitive, Ethical and Societal Dimensions of Artificial Intelligence, held in Porto, Portugal. It targets graduate and postgraduate students as well as industry practitioners, offering parallel courses, face‑to‑face networking, and live online participation. All lectures are recorded and available for 45 days after the event, and participants receive a certificate indicating the number of academic hours completed.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
venue: Umeå University, Umeå, Sweden
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems takes place at Umeå University in Sweden. It offers lectures, multidisciplinary hands‑on training, a poster session and a social program aimed at researchers, students and professionals interested in responsible AI. Participants will have opportunities to network, exchange ideas and explore the societal implications of AI and autonomous systems.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
venue: Escandille, Autrans, France
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM) 2026 takes place at the Escandille in Autrans, France. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses, talks and hands‑on sessions. The scenic Vercors‑mountain setting also offers opportunities for outdoor activities and informal networking.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
venue: Sandridge Events Centre, Port Melbourne, Australia
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) takes place in Melbourne, Australia at the Sandridge Events Centre. It targets 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers, offering two weeks of lectures and tutorials covering core theory and emerging topics beyond large language models. World‑class speakers from academia and industry present on subjects such as deep learning, generative modeling, reinforcement learning, and AI in industry, with stipends available for selected participants.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The 2027 Winter School is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference and will be held at UiT The Arctic University of Norway in Tromsø. It focuses on deep learning, covering state-of-the-art methods for image classification, object detection, segmentation, time series prediction, and speech recognition. The school aims to bring together researchers to exchange ideas, foster collaborations, and present cutting‑edge research in the field.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
venue: Swostishree Gurukul, Sanobharyang, Kathmandu, Nepal
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School is a two‑week intensive program offering AI lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work. It covers fundamentals through cutting‑edge applications across domains such as computer vision, NLP, and responsible AI, targeting senior undergraduates, graduate students, researchers, faculty, and industry professionals. The school brings together over 500 in‑person participants and thousands of online viewers at Swostishree Gurukul in Sanobharyang, Kathmandu, Nepal.

name: EEML Summer School
venue: Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School, Cetinje, Montenegro
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. It offers a series of lectures and tutorials delivered by leading researchers from institutions such as Google DeepMind, IST Austria, NYU, EPFL and many others. The program is aimed at students and early‑career researchers interested in machine learning, providing hands‑on learning opportunities and networking with experts and sponsors.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School offers a focused five‑day program of keynotes, lectures, and practical sessions led by experienced AI experts. It targets doctoral and exceptional master students, as well as academics and practitioners worldwide, with a particular emphasis on the Mediterranean region. Participants can engage with state‑of‑the‑art machine‑learning topics, present their work in poster sessions, and network through social and cultural activities.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The 2nd edition of the AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI will be held at the Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications in Rabat, Morocco. The five‑day program, organized by MoroccoAI, INPT, IMT Nord Europe and Soft Centre, offers young researchers, Ph.D. students and professionals in‑depth lectures, hands‑on labs, and project mentorship covering state‑of‑the‑art multimodal and generative AI techniques. Participants will also benefit from networking events and panels designed to build the next generation of AI leaders in Morocco.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
venue: NCSR Demokritos, Athens, Greece
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the NCSR Demokritos campus in Athens, Greece. The program focuses on recent advances in NLP and provides intensive lectures and hands‑on sessions for students and researchers. It is jointly organized by RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business, and Heriot‑Watt University.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It is designed for STEM students with intermediate AI/ML experience who are interested in both theoretical foundations and practical, real‑world applications. The programme is offered as a residential or online course, providing hands‑on experience and career‑relevant skills across a range of domains.

name: AI4Science Summer School
venue: Caen, Normandy, France
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI takes place in Caen, Normandy, France. It offers a comprehensive program covering machine learning for scientific data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and integration of AI with physical simulations, featuring hands‑on workshops and case studies led by renowned experts. The school is aimed at PhD students, post‑doctoral researchers and scientists familiar with mathematical modelling, numerical computation and Python programming.

name: LUT Summer School
venue: LUT University, Lappeenranta, Finland
description: LUT Summer School is a one‑week intensive programme offering courses on sustainability, climate action, marketing, management, and the intersection of business and technology. It is aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students from any university, with a mix of workshops, lectures, group work and a vibrant social programme set in the Finnish summer landscape. Participants receive 3 ECTS credits, access to campus facilities, and the opportunity to experience Finnish nature while building an international network.
